p: The use of nanotechnology can potentialize the EO effects. Lecithin-based nanoemulsion of clove oil showed faster anesthesia induction and recovery in goldfish, Carassius auratus. Serum glucose was not different, but serum urea was higher in goldfish anesthetized with the nanoemulsion than with free clove oil ( Gholipourkanani et al., 2015). The nanoencapsulated EO of M. alternifolia exert potent bactericidal action, presenting 100% of curative efficacy in silver catfish infected with Pseudomonas aeruginosa, while free EO only showed 70% of curative efficacy ( Souza et al., 2017c). Consequently, nanotechnology shows promising results that deserve further analysis.
